title: The myth of the bespoke brand
excerpt: While it’s typically used to describe tailor-made fashion, the word ‘bespoke’ can be defined as anything that is “made for a particular customer or user.”

children.text: While it’s typically used to describe tailor-made fashion, the word ‘bespoke’ can be defined as anything that is “made for a particular customer or user.”
Besides the fact that 'bespoke' so overused in business mission statements it’s trite, it’s also blatantly self-evident.
Of course(!) you’re a bespoke brand—built for your customers, designed around their problems, made to match their needs, goals, and ambitions. That’s what a business is
To do anything less is a hindrance.
